body.p:
Henderson Ky. Decr 18th 1863.
To
His Excellency Govr Bramlette
Frankfort Ky.
Sir

The undersigned would respectfully state that under an indictment (for "standing a stud Horse without license") in Henderson Circuit Court, he was upon yesterday, by a Jury of the county, fined the sum of Forty Dollars. The facts are briefly these. The undersigned went to St Louis on business and was detained there for some time by sickness & did not return to Henderson for about eighteen days after his agent commenced to stand the Horse "Highlander". As soon as the undersigned returned. to wit on the 18th June he procurred license. The offense was committed on or about the 1st June last. He stated that he had no intention to evade or violate the law and prays that the executive clemency be interposed in his behalf
The undersigned, members of the jury who found the verdict in the case of Comth of Ky vs Taill would respectfully join in the prayer of the above petition

Griffin
A Q Goode
A. J. Hecks
W H Sandefer
William duncan
C. T. Sandefer
F Weller
Wm Wells
W. G. Hopgood
Tilman Gibson
(over)
From all I have learned of the case refered to in the within petition I believe it entitled to the favorable consideration of the Executive

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
